page.title: 12POULTON HALL I
page.content: Poulton Hall has been the home of the Lancelyn family since the Eleventh Century. They built some kind of castle at the highest point in the area near the present Poulton Hall; the original earthworks can still be seen. The Hall was built about 1685 and has been greatly altered and enlarged over the years. It is L_shaped in plan with pebble_dashed rendering. Poulton Hall has one small room on the top floor, which has been set aside to the memory of Sherlock Holmes. This is a remarkable reconstruction of 221B Baker Street, London, where the fictional Holmes lived. The room was faithfully furnished by the Lancelyn_Green's younger son, Richard, when he was only 13.
